block.p: Ashley Elizabeth True, the daughter of Thea True and T. Craig True of Amelia Island Fla., is to be married today to Aaron Charles Lang, the son of Dr. Enid A. Lang and Norton D. Lang of Scarsdale, N.Y. The Rev. Cathy Barksdale, a United Methodist minister, officiated at the Ribault Club on Fort George Island in Jacksonville, Fla.

The couple, both 25, are associates at New York law firms, she at Thacher Proffitt & Wood, and he at Dewey Ballantine. The bride, who graduated from Wake Forest University, and the bridegroom, a graduate of Harvard, met at Duke University, from which they received their law degrees.

Ashley Elizabeth True, the daughter of Thea True and T. Craig True of Amelia Island Fla., is to be married today to Aaron Charles Lang, the son of Dr. Enid A. Lang and Norton D. Lang of Scarsdale, N.Y. The Rev. Cathy Barksdale, a United Methodist minister, officiated at the Ribault Club on Fort George Island in Jacksonville, Fla.

Ashley Elizabeth True, the daughter of Thea True and T. Craig True of Amelia Island Fla., is to be married today to Aaron Charles Lang, the son of Dr. Enid A. Lang and Norton D. Lang of Scarsdale, N.Y. The Rev. Cathy Barksdale, a United Methodist minister, officiated at the Ribault Club on Fort George Island in Jacksonville, Fla.

The couple, both 25, are associates at New York law firms, she at Thacher Proffitt & Wood, and he at Dewey Ballantine. The bride, who graduated from Wake Forest University, and the bridegroom, a graduate of Harvard, met at Duke University, from which they received their law degrees.
The bride's father is a partner in the McLean, Va., office of PricewaterhouseCoopers, the accounting and consulting firm.

The bridegroom's mother is retired. She had a private psychiatric practice, and was an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine in New York. His father, a physicist, is on the research staff at I.B.M. in Yorktown Heights, N.Y.
